author: don
post: I find it hard to believe that most of the paint flaked off the shroud. A shroud thread contain many fibers (I don’t know the approximate number of fibers per thread), there would have been paint residues between fibers. It would have been very difficult to remove the all residues even if you try. If it did flake off, wouldn’t there be damage to the fibers at microscopic level? Like a slight pull from the body of the thread?.
